name: Hotel Sabrina

reviews.text: I was booked into this hotel for a week as part of an artist's retreat. I knew I wasn't going to be happy from the minute I walked into the lobby (about 10 square feet) and discovered that my room was on the third floor and no elevator. I struggled with my suitcase up three flights of stairs only to find one of the worst rooms I have ever seen. It had one bulb in the ceiling to light the entire room and no reading lights near the bed. The bathroom was tiny and not very clean...and the odor was just overwhelming. I was forced to stay one night but got out of there the very next morning and found another hotel. Other reviewers have tried to pass this hotel off as a charming bed and breakfast type establishment, but there is charming and then there is dump - Hotel Sabrina falls into the latter category.
reviews.title: Three stars are just a joke!
Great hotel!
reviews.text: We stayed in the top floor suite of Hotel Sabrina. The management is very friendly and accomodating. The grandmother serves the breakfast in the morning and makes "to-order" coffee of choice. The bathroom showers are pretty small but that is pretty normal in Italy. The location was phenomenal as a walk to the center was only three minutes. Very close to cafe's and shopping. We received hugs from both the grandmother and daughter on our last day there! :)

reviews.title: Wonderful stay at Hotel Sabrina
reviews.text: The Hotel Sabrina was the best hotel our family group stayed at during our trip. Both double rooms were very comfortable, clean and quiet. The breakfast was large and delicious, including homemade bread & jam, cereal, yogurt, juice and cappuccino. It's a very short walk from the town center. We travelled by train & bus so driving & parking wasn't a concern. Not all the staff spoke English (but it is Italy) but we had no trouble communicating with our very limited Italian.

reviews.title: Don't believe Sabrina's 3-star rating
reviews.text: The price was very reasonable at 75 Euro (off season rate).

description: The Hotel Sabrina, located in the historical center of Cortona is in a fine, old sixteenth century building, once the residence of the famous sculptor Fabbrucci; it offers its guests a warm and friendly atmosphere with simply but tastefully furnished rooms. In the small Hall it's offers excellent and genuine rich breakfasts with delicious hot tarts and home-made jams, juice and bread. Every room has en-suite bathroom, TV, direct telephone, safe and everything required for passing a marvelous stay in the Etruscan town of Cortona.
